text: I have a question for the community: I am trying to recreate the contact sales landing page from HubSpot, but the modules do not align nicely. Any idea's on how to fix this?
<@UGPRJ4DS9> if you're using the drag n' drop designer, you should move the chat module into a group with the call us module so they are on the same row as the book a meeting module.
but will I then still be able to have two separate grey blocks?
I wish everything in life was this easy
Is possibile add data attributes to the advanced menu? Obv without doing the menu with an hubdb table

I’ve a dimensions issue with SVGs. My picture is 520 x 404 px, but when uploaded to HubSpot the dimensions indicate 78 x 60 px.
I tried to narrow down the issue and found out that if I change the shadow of my rectangle from 20px to 10px I get the correct dimensions on HubSpot. So any images I create in Sketch that has a rectangle with a 20px (or bigger) shadow, and that is exported as SVG (optimized or not) gives 78 x 60 px dimensions in HubSpot… Did anyone ran into a similar issue?
haven't experienced this, but you may want to try adding width and height attributes that are the same as the viewbox.
That not really an option when using images in responsive modules. Right now those SVG files render at 78x60px in the modules.
I meant in the SVG file itself. Open the file in a text editor and add the attributes, save, then upload to HubSpot and see if it calculates the size correctly
